question: Playback singer Mohammed Aziz, who passed away recently, was from which state?
explanation: Playback singer Mohammed Aziz (64) has passed away in Mumbai, Maharashtra on November 27, 2018. Born in Ashoknagar, West Bengal, he was the voice behind evergreen tracks such as \"My name is Lakhan\", \"Aap ke aa jane se\" and \"Dil le gayi teri bindiya‚Äù. Aziz, who has over 20,000 songs to his credit, has sung in Bollywood, Bengali and Odia film industries. He has recorded several devotional bhajans and Sufi songs as well.  has recorded several devotional bhajans and Sufi songs as well. He made his film debut with Bengali film, \"Jyoti\". His career spanned over three decades and his collaboration with music composers like Kalyanji-Anandji, Laxmikant-Pyarelal, Rahul Dev Burman, Naushad, OP Nayyar, Bappi Lahiri, Rajesh Roshan and Ravindra Jain have resulted in some of most iconic songs that people remember.
